sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products formed when calcium carbonate is heated? Provide the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and predict the physical state of each product.
message_2:
When calcium carbonate (CaCO3) is heated, it undergoes a decomposition reaction to form calcium oxide (CaO) and carbon dioxide (CO2). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CaCO3 (s) â†’ CaO (s) + CO2 (g)

In this equation, (s) denotes the solid state and (g) denotes the gas state. So, calcium carbonate is a solid, calcium oxide is also a solid, and carbon dioxide is a gas.
